page.title: 07PRESCOTT CHAPEL, CULMSTOCK
page.content: This BAPTIST CHAPEL was built in 1785 on the site of a former meeting house erected in 1718. It has unusual Georgian windows and a colonnaded entrance. In 1892 typical Victorian windows were put in at the side and back of the building and new pews in the main body of the Hall. There is an unusual ceiling of 3 arcs and a steeply sloping gallery on 3 sides, which contains what are probably the original narrow bench seats, with the date 1703 scratched on one. Outside, is a beautiful graveyard with old stones, the earliest with the date 1753.The Prescott Lecture Room Building Fund was started and 'PRESCOTT MISSION HALL' was built in the village of Culmstock in 1889 at a cost, including furnishings, of Â£206.8s.0d. PRESCOTT and CULMSTOCK CHAPELS are used frequently today.
